meanings.definition: A radioactive metallic element, symbol Th, used in nuclear reactors.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of thoria in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The workers handled thoria with caution due to its radioactive nature.
meanings.sent3: The thoria in the reactor decided to throw a party for the other elements.
meanings.sent4: The power of thoria in the reactor was like a silent guardian, protecting all.
meanings.sent5: The glow of thoria in the dark room was both eerie and fascinating.

meanings.definition: A compound of thorium and oxygen, used in gas mantles.
meanings.sent1: The thoria in the gas mantle emitted a bright light when ignited.
meanings.sent2: The miners extracted thoria from the earth to create gas mantles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous thoria in the gas mantle played tricks on the other compounds.
meanings.sent4: The thoria in the gas mantle was a beacon of light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The warmth from the thoria in the gas mantle kept the room cozy.
